chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: Diary of Elizabeth Anne Jennings, later Anne Jennings Krush. Known to me and her other grandchildren as "Nanny." Her eldest daughter, Carol Krush, inherited all of Nanny's journals. Aunt Carol sent the journals to me in February, 2020.
This journal has an interesting set-up; one page for each day of the year, but with lines allowing entries for the same day on four different years.

listitem.para: 1931 - Saturday. Regatta at Country Club. Boat races. Dance tonite, but I was too tired. Bed early & darned sorry I didn't (couldn't) go!
1932 - Mon. Haircut. Town with Munny. Shopped. Home. Visited John. Baseball game. Got a checking account. Packed for tomorrow & worked around.
1933 - Tues. Mrs. Townsend, Peggy & Judd to Carling for Peg's ear. We played bridge & swam & messed around. Nellie came over. Her dog has pups. paddled with Harry tonite after (?) supper.

1934 - Wed. Worked on dress somewhat. Fun at school but still didn't learn Israel Kaufmann's name. Babs, Wally, Joey & I to carnival at Cory then to Babs for eats. B'gosh, I almost fell for Joey again, di, I've got to be careful! Oh me!

1935 - Thurs. quite a talk with Bill about independence. But he's so cute di, I can't scold him! Worked hard & Uncle Mose liked the wine. Met Dr. Jenney, taller than me. Home on train with Bill & then swim at Club. Dinner. Tennis with Joey & I was lousy. Fun. Hot today. home. Bed 11:15!! Munny is a lamb & I love her so much, di!!
1931 - Sunday. Got up at 11. Leta sick. Rotten day. Read "Dark Forest." Swam a little in aft. Read tonite & bed about 12.

1932 - Tues. Packed. Franny & Picnic lunch at McKnight's pool! Bill, Sally, Joey & Wally to see me off. Said g'bye to John! Better off & cute letter from Joey. I'll see you in the a.m Canada! Hot dogs!
1933 - Wed. Up late. Knitted. Bridge in aft till 4. Swam then. Betty, Judd & Chico to dance. Honey, Peggy & I whopped it up. Honey & I paddled to Wheaton's for my bracelet. Fun.
1934 - Thurs. School as usual. Charlotte & I to movies tonite to see "The Thin Man." Best movie I've seen in years. To Pharmacy for black & white sundaes. Home & read.

1935 - Fri. Wotta day. Drove up with B & Bill. Bill's so sweet! Worked. Dobby & Franny in at noon. Then, broke glasses - great wind. Uncle Mose Langer drove me all way home & back to town - so nice, di!! Then met M.W. Stouffers for dinner. Stanley to see "Becky Sharp." Good. Home. Sat with Munny. Bed late. Everybody's so nice!!!
1931 - Monday. Fooled around the house. H. drove us to Footes Bay. Ice cream cones & back again. Loads of fun.
1932 - Wed. Got to Toronto. Scared. Changed train to Footes Bay. Arrived 2:20. Met by Towny Moore. Got here. Lousy weather, but am enjoying myself!
1933 - Thurs. Rain & cold in a.m. Discouraged. Cleaned. Picnic on Annes. Gubby silly as usual. Kenny Pesny there. Full moon. Grand time. Home about 2. Sherry. Food. Bed late!

1934 - Friday. Cut class today. Bridge party at Millers for Margaret Watts - a Wellesleyite. Fun. Babs, Wally, Dan & I to Union Cafe tonite. I had 2 Old Fashioneds & part of a Stinger. We were happy. Bed late.

1935 - Sat. Up in car with Bill. Then worked till about noon. Home & I think Bill has a heavy with Jane Terry tonite. Why do I worry, after what he has said & done? Nature, I guess. Franny had a tea for Dobby. Went after swim at Club with M.W. Then Babs for dinner. She & Walter & Joey & I played Monopoly after movies to see "$10 Raise ".
1931 - Tuesday. Leta still sick. Washed dishes etc. Woodsed. H tried to drag me in lake 'cause I took his picture. He didn't & was kind. Bob griped(?) me.
1932 - Thurs. Honey & I paddled to Footes Bay. Ate crazy picnic lunch. To Stony Brae. Paddled back. Letter from Mum. Messed around & read tonite.

1933 - Fri. Up & finished packing. Awful to leave. Gub took us to station. G'byes. Sad. Kisses, etc! Honey, Chico & I to Toronto. Honey left with family. Chico & I to movie "Voltaire" Good. Hurried dinner. Excited. Sat till 12. Knitted.

1934 - Sat. Up late. No hangover. Bill here for a few minutes. I nearly fainted. Babs & I to town & saw Leslie Howard & Betty Davis in "Of Human Bondage." Very good! To Babs' for supper. Dan came. We three went to movies & saw "Little Miss Marker." Babs' lip cut. Wally came later.

1935 - Sun. Up at 11. Babs stayed while. Bill came & then Dobby & Franny for min. Bill left. Charlotte came & here for dinner & then she & M.W. & I to Oakmont to races. Fun. Motorboats. They came home with me for while. Then Munny & I, fun. Listened to Major Bowse & missed not seeing Bill. My psychology is not letting me understand Bill. I wish I could, di!
1931 - Wednesday. Played tennis at Country Club. I beat Walt 6-3. He beat me 6-4. I beat Peggy 6-3 & 6-2. Swam twice. Dead & blisters tonite.
1932 - Fri. Washed some clothes. Went to Pardows in aft. Came home. Slept. Rain. Swam with Honey. Mrs. Townsend, Honey & I talked. Read & ate in kitchen & bed.

1933 - Sat. Arrived home 8:15. Dan here in a.m. also Wally. Bill came this aft & was here till late. Just as swell as ever. Date tonite with Don. Wally& Babs, Franny, Jim, Joey, Bricky Rhoads. Movies Bellevue. Home & ate. Bill, John & Looey here. Got to bed at 2. (?) is swell!

1934 - Sun. Up at 9. Pop sore at something. Bill came at 12 & stayed for dinner. Looked swell! Joey came & we three went to club to see Sam & Dr. John beat Dr. Dave & Billy O'Lough(?) 4-6; 6-3; 2-6; 6-0; 6-2. Over 5:30. (12 - 5:30!) Babs' party tonite. Fun except Richard (?)

1935 - Mon. Blue Mon. Miss Bailey sor of off. Came home after work & Mom was in awful sour grapes. Tried to blame it all on me, but she isn't feeling well, I guess. Made me feel good(?), but Bill came, as I hoped. Watched tennis. Then to movies. Victor McLaglen in "The Informer." Very good. Home. Gingerale. Mom in bad mood still & stayed up long after I went to bed reading. Couldn't say what I wanted to Bill.
1931 - Thursday. Betty & Mrs. Townsend arrived. All went swimming. Betty is awfully nice. I like her heaps.
1932 - Sat. Up early. Read & fooled in a.m. Paddled to Footes Bay & drove to Bracebridge with Honey, Peggy & Betty T. Got yarn. Watermelon feast at Arma tonite. Home. Dead tired. Bed late.
1933 - Sun. Up at 12:454. Bill here. Wally & I to Bab's this aft. Dan there. Bridge & wine & crazy game. More fun. Dan & I fought on porch, but he isn't so bad. Loads of fun. Home. Bed late.

1934 - Up at 9. Tennis with Joey. 3-6 & 7-5. Fun. Found out boy's name is Jack Tracy. Martha told me. Awful lecture & Dr. McKinley embarrassed us, about reprod. urge. Home & read tonite. Dan & Babs called about Dan's (?) French theme. Oh me!

1935 - Tues. Up & on train with Bill. Worked a good day. Home with Dr. Stock in great rain & he drives well! He is extremely nice, di! Mary-Wells & Dan came tonite & we talked & fooled. They left about 10. Bed & I missed Bill, but wot the 'ell!
1931 - Friday. Started "My First Two Thousand Years" by Eldridge & Viereck. Terribly good. Discussion on Slums. H & Peg vs. Betty & me.
1932 - Sun. Up real late. Cold! Letters Warmer in aft & swim a la nature! Read & messed around & ate this evening. Bed early.

1933 - Mon. Town with Munny. Got clothes. Home. Bill here. He & Wally & I talked. Hair cut at 3. Dan, Babs, Wally & I to town to Penn. Rob't Montgomerty in "Another Language." Good! Home. Fight. John.

1934 - Tues. Answered a few letters etc. Worked on dress. School is fun & Jack Franey is O.K. Wears a different tie every day to school. Wally & I to say G'bye to Babs. I came home early & read more of "War & Peace" by Tolstoy.

1935 - Wed. To station & train with Bill. He seemed better today. Mixed up urines, but worked hard most of day. Home with Bill & Munny met us. Saw Chubby again. Bill came for ice-cream. Wouldn't go to E(?) Then went to say G'bye to Dobby. Home & Munny & I sat. Ate rest of grand ice cream. She was so nice to me tonite, di. The first for several days & I do love her so much.
1931 - Saturday. Gub & H had dumb argument. Sater, H, Peggy, Betty & I had discussion.
1932 - Mon. Knitted & read. A World Begins by Skariatina. Over to Arma for Springer's birthday party. Gubby mean. Loads of fun. Home when storm threatened. Tired. Washed socks in lake.

1933 - Tues. Washed, etc. Bill is grand! Marriage discussion. Bill came before lunch & we had long talk on swing. He has job. Good kid! Horse shoes. Wally, Joe, Ginny R & Red came. Bill left. To Franny's tonite. Home bed early.

1934 - Wed. Worked around in a.m. Out to college & made dots till I'm blue in the face. Babs left today for country. To Izzy's & there again this evening. We went over to see her Bill. Tazzy(?) is nice. Home. Got Walter at 11 & bed soon after.

1935 - Thurs. Bill 'n' I drove on up to town. Worked hard all day. Saw Jean Dobbs's parents. Got writing paper. Then home in car with Bill & something is indeed wront. I shall remedy it. Wrote 7 letters tonite. Called Franny Forsdick, & M.W., also Polly Frederic. Munny & I sat together. Then bed. Get ready for tomorrow!
1931 - Sunday. The folks all went to church. H drove us all around. I was silly & got griped. H is disgusted I guess. Darn it!
1932 - Tues. Over to Pardows. Swam in aft. Paddled to Wheatons & Arma tonite with Peggy, Honey & Betty. Home & moonlight swim. Eats, talk & bed late.

1933 - Wed. Tennis with Wally. Bill here, Jack Deasy. Canoed & sailed with Wally & Joey. Fun. Dan came tonite & we all went to Franny's for bridge. Fun. Bill starts work tomorrow. Won't see him much now.

1934 - Thurs. Worked on drawings etc in a.m. Took Izzy & Catherine to town. Quite a talk with Jack. He thought I was a school teacher. Oh me! Google-Eyes wanted a ride but I fooled him. Studied tonite & Munny & I listened to radio. Wally came in later & talked.

1935 - Fri. Up on train with Bill. We talked of this & that. He acts so nice & yet seems distant. Oh well!! Tea at Polly Fredericks after Mrs. Merrill brot me down. O.K. Then Babs, Wally, Dan & I to "Pines." Loads of fun. Got nice & tight, then to Gamm(?) in East Lib. Home at 3:15 & I just sort of fell into bed!
1931 - Monday. Peggy drove us to Carling. Mrs. Townsend & Frankie scared. Met Marg, Brownie & Lib. Bought cookies. Woodsed.
1932 - Wed. Up late. Knitted. Swam in aft. Also paddled.
1933 - Thurs. Rained & spoiled picnic. Jack Deasy, John Keeney, Morten Moore, John, Wally & I bridge. I was mad. Bridge party here tonite a tableo. FUn. Dumb prizes. Bed 2:30. Oh dear!

1934 - Fri. Bill here this a.m. Wine. Talked & he read & I worked. Oh di, I still can't help it! Janet Sleece at school. Jack Francy's a Beta & is 22. We worked a bit. Dan here tonite & we went to movies "Half a Sinner" & "Call it Luck." Wally came & we all drank. Bed. Great heat.

1935 - Sat. Nothing much more coiuld happen to make things worse. Bill & his father & I drove to town. He was funny on way down. I was still under-influence, I guess. Came this aft when M.W. here & left quite soon. Damn. Then Prill called & is in town. Maybe it's good she came when he's so cool & won't be around! God, di - I'm in love too, too much & I just can't help it!
1931 - Tuesday. Went woodsing in a.m. Painted etc. Tipped canoe in aft & so just read advertisement at cabin.
1932 - Thurs. Cleared away the brush & went for a swim. Wrote letters & generally messed around. Looked at stars tonite - shooting. Interesting clouds.
1933 - Fri. To see Izzy Clark in a.m. To Lib Crampton's for bridge this aft. Won 3rd prize. Met Dee Klug. Good. Dan, Wally, Franny & I to movies in Ambridge. Home Bridge. Bed 2.

1934 - Sat. Rain. No tennis. Worked about & read most of day. Charlotte here this evening. Talked. Fun. Wally & Joey came at 11:30. Charlotte home 12. Little ride, di, oh me! I don't know what my trouble is. I can't be in love, but Joey was warming up! 'Nite.

1935 - Sun. Up late. Bill came at noon & stayed for dinner with Mom 'n' Pop 'n' me. Here all aft & we talked & read. Everything joke(?) again, di & I'm happy. Left at 5:30. I called M.W., then up to Izzy's & we had grand talk. She' so awfully nice. Then home & letters & bed early. Shooting stars tonite.
1931 - Wednesday. H pushed me in lake. Fooled around in aft & went swimming. He didn't want to.
1932 - Fri. Went moonlite swimming tonite & had grand time. More shooting stars. Peg & Betty slept on dock.

1933 - Sat. Town with M.W. Shopped & saw "Tugboat Annie." To see A.H. Not home. To M.W.'s for supper. Home. Billy, Wally & Dan, Charlotte later. Bridge. Shooting stars. Hair. Bed. Bill here, but I wasn't!

1934 - Sun. Bill here today for quite a time. Another swell talk, about books & reminisicing! I hope he & I will always be grand friends! Read tonite & studied a mite. Do I like Joey again or don't I? I think I do. Oh my!

1935 - Mon. Up on train with Bill. Beginning last week of work. Awful thot!! Home & Pop home. In sort of bad humor. I was sick 'cause Bill didn't come tonite. Then Izzy & her aunt & I to Ambridge to see "Broadway Melody." Dick Powell good. Home Bed. Tired & I wonder just what troubles Bill.
